snippet: As the 70th anniversary of the biggest roundup of French Jews is observed, and British silver from a ship sank by Nazi submarines is recovered, some are asking whether Europe is at risk of forgetting its painful history.
abstract: As the 70th anniversary of the biggest roundup of French Jews is observed, and British silver from a ship sank by Nazi submarines is recovered, some are asking whether Europe is at risk of forgetting its painful history.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
